Posts.Content: May 26, 2012 06:30AM cromercrab60 wrote: I had a nasty reaction to rads. In the UK we have dressings nurses attached to the radiotherapy dept. As soon as my skin started to go pink she used hydra gel which came in tubes, and secured a dressing over the top. I was warned that I would still 'cook' for a week after treatment had finished and the wound would get worse. It did 8-(. But, then it healed really quickly. It was needing dressings for only 3 days after the cooking period and two days later completely healed. That was in February. It now looks like an odd square of sunburn lol
Posts.Title: A rad onc weighs in on radiation "burns" Spinnerpom 53nancy

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2013 06:06PM cromercrab60 wrote: Hi. I have day 8 treatment cycle 5 tomorrow. Tolerating this a lot better than navelbine. Not as draggingly tired and I have an appetite! Going to have a trip to the seaside for a few days Thursday. Norfolk. I'm in England by the way. I have some issues with my pelvis, where they think I have a suspected fracture. Keeping on top of it with painkillers though X Sarah
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2013 12:21PM cromercrab60 wrote: Numbness is an sE. I've had random cramps in my foot and can see my toes curling literally. Random. It happens the day after treatment and then goes away. Quite painful but only lasts for about a minute ir so at a time. I'm now on cycle 6. My registrar told me they only give 6 cycles SO i went to see my oncologist prepared to do battle citing my understanding that in the us they give it until it's no longer effective. My onc grinned at me and said I was the first if his 6 patients that had tried the drug to do well on it. And then said if everything was good at next examination in three weeks time he would sign off on another four! It's a new thing in the uk. I'm so glad of this thread as it prepared me for what I could expect since theres very little info in the uk. My hair thinned but is still there. I get steroids and odansetron in pre med. Odansetron causes constipation so I take a docsulate at night for a couple of days after treatment and it sorts itself out. I also try to eat foods to help things along a bit. I made a lovely apple and rhubarb crumble yesterday. Yum! Also, a couple of dates every now and then help lots. I started eating them instead of eating sweets cos I'm far too over weight now due to stuffing my face and then not being able to exercise too much due to hip. X Sarah
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2013 05:29PM cromercrab60 wrote: My onc is pretty hot stuff. Cutting edge of research etc. He's biopsied me twice and I am waiting for another appt for one as he wants to see if my status has changed as he has me in mind for a trial targeted therapy treatment and wants everything in place in plenty of time. I'm very fortunate. I'm on top dose at the moment. I'm weaning myself of the steroid dose as I become more confident with this drug. I hate feeling sick. Steroids are ok at the moment because they ease the pain in my hip a bit and also sorted out blocked saliva gland this treatment. So it's been a bit handy! X Sarah
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: May 22, 2012 11:51AM cromercrab60 wrote: Hi there. Very sorry to hear your news. Can't really say anything more except give you a cyber hug x
Posts.Title: And the crap news today is... alesta29 LauraOntario

Posts.Content: May 22, 2012 06:08PM cromercrab60 wrote: Hi. I'm in the UK. I have top dose of Navelbine orally day 1 and day 8. Fatigue is a problem for me too. I also have Zometa every 6 weeks for my bone mets. I will see onc Thursday to see if things are working out as we hope. Interestingly I didn't have a blood test this time before day 8. Onc is of the opinion that I will be taking the tablets anyway. I was a little trepedacious but it's been ok. I've just come back from the seaside, but couldn't do all I wanted which was frustrating. I've been taking rinatdine which is an anti acid. This has helped promote my appetite which can be dodgy. Also I take docsulate capsules twice a day for three days after doses and that has sorted out my innards so to speak.
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: May 24, 2012 05:19PM cromercrab60 wrote: Things seem to be going ok. Bones show signs of healing. CT scan showed no further spread..phew. Also affected nodes had shrunk. Just disease in chest wall to clobber now, even that looks a bit better I think
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2012 11:10AM cromercrab60 wrote: My temp spike reached epic proportions on Saturday night. 39.2! Struggled to get it down as it was very humid that night in the uk. Tried to keep calm as I didn't feel ill as I should do if I was really running a fever. This morning 36.5. have to take my second dose Friday. I have now developed a sore mouth, and feel lacking in energy but so much better than at the weekend when I couldn't really get out of bed 8-(
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2012 08:08PM cromercrab60 wrote: Phoned my breast care nurse about my sore mouth and had to go to the emergency room(A&E in the UK). I was kept in until Sunday morning. I was on iv antibiotics until Friday morning. I now realise that the temp might be the only indication that all is not well. Neutropenia. ! My blood count is probably still low but I do feel a bit better. The gave me a nuelesta jab to help things along too. If you have a temp please do not ignore it like I did. X Sarah
Posts.Title: For those on navelbine LuAnnH onedayatatime

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2012 07:29PM cromercrab60 wrote: The day after I take it I often have a temp spike. I ignore it most of the time. Managed to go to 38.8 c on one occasion. I put the fan on, have cooling drinks and that usually brings it down. I was told to go to a&e if it stayed over 38 for a while, about an hour. It can happen day after that too. My thermostat is not very good and I tend to overheat easily and I put it down to navelbine.
